reviews.text: An interesting place to visit if you're in the Ballarat area. Lots of information on the region's history and great bits and pieces to see, many of which are also interactive. A two minute walk from Sovereign Hill definitely makes the museum a worthwhile part of any Sovereign Hill visit. Pictured are the cylinders from a Japanese flamethrower (Second World War).
Great museum which covers all aspects of gold mining in the region. You can do it as part of Sovereign Hill or on its own. Loved reading all about the history :)

We had heard that this was the #1 museum in Bogota, and weren't disappointed. The collection is wonderful, but what we liked best was the many ways in which it was informed by the history of the indigenous people of Colombia, the methods of working gold and other metals, etc. I only wished there had been more information on how this much gold escaped Spanish predation, and the archaeology of its recovery. But that's minor in comparison with the displays and presentation. This is a DON'T MISS!
The whole museum is well laid out and presents a great overview of the history of Ballarat and the goldfields, along with interesting historical artifacts. Very Informative!

Museum is very interactive and interesting for both kids and adults. It will give you a lot of information about the mining history of Ballarat and the establishment of the city. Also big thanks to volunteer Joan, it was very very pleasant to talk to her and ask her a lot of question about the museum and life of the city. Highly recommended.
